page.title: 07ENGLEFIELD PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: A school was built in Englefield in 1865 to educate the Estate children. It is still a Church of England Primary School but most pupils travel in from outside the estate. The main building is the original school and an additional one was constructed in 1977 to house an extra classroom and school kitchen. One boy described his day. "After registration we do maths or spelling and English work. Assembly with the whole school is at 10:15. Then it is break. We play bulldog. We have swimming next because we can use the Benyon's pool on the Estate. 12:00 Dinner: fish and chips is my favourite. In the afternoon we do project work, and at break we play rounders. After clearing up we have a story together as a class. Then there are prayers and home on the coach".
